intro: Ferula pauciflora, commonly known as the small-flowered ferula, is a perennial herb native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fibrous roots are known for their medicinal properties and are used in traditional medicine. Ferula pauciflora is also valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in harsh environmental conditions.
